snippet: Its report said newborns and mothers faced particularly acute risks in Afghanistan, the Central African Republic, Iraq, South Sudan and Syria.
abstract: Unicef says almost 16.6 million babies were born in conflict zones in 2015; states babies and mothers faced worst risks in Afghanistan, Central African Republic, Iraq, South Sudan and Syria.
lead_paragraph: Its report said newborns and mothers faced particularly acute risks in Afghanistan, the Central African Republic, Iraq, South Sudan and Syria.

headline.main: Millions of Babies at Risk, Unicef Says
headline.print_headline: United Nations; Millions of Babies at Risk, Unicef Says
